answers.answer: HiThanks for the post! I am sorry to hear about your daughter.Your daughter could be suffering from tapeworm infestation, resulting in anemia and generalized swelling. Nausea and abdominal pain too is common in tapeworm infestation. A stool examination should definitely be done. She could also be suffering from glomerulonephritis (kidney infection) or nephritic syndrome. Is her blood pressure high? She could also be having hypothyroidism. If she is not keeping well then please take her to ER and discuss this with the doctor there. Try and get an earlier referral or atleast get stool examined and check for anemia.Get other tests for kidney function done.It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: PLEASE help.  My 7 year old daughter has been having many symptoms for months, abdominal pain and nausea being the worst.  She has gained weight about 15 pounds in 4 or 5 months.  She gained 5lbs in one month.  She looks puffy and her stomach looks bloated.  Last week she was peeing blood.  I thought she had a bladder infection.  She peed blood once before in the middle of the night and I took her to the emergency room and they found nothing. This was when she was four.  Not even any more blood in her urine.  She started complaining of abdominal pain and nausea when she was four.  She would wake up throwing up mucus in the middle of the night and the doctors said it was allergies.  Throughout the year abdominal pain has still been there just a lot worse now.  Other symtoms include severe personality change, fuzzy throat, headache, dizziness, itchy skin, tingly hands, tired, weak, always hungry, and episodes of be wetting.  I took her to the doctor one week ago they ran blood tests and said her labs were good.  She does not have diabetes.  She did have a high level of protein (137.9) normal being (0-17).  They set up an appoint. with a kidney specialist for monday Dec. 2nd but I'm not sure she will last that long.  The abdominal pain and fuzzy throat are realt getting more constant.  The abdominal pain is made worse by eating and laying down.  She actually feels better with movement.  I don't know what to do.  Should I just take her to the emergency room and not wait for the doc. appoint.  She does play and act normal most of the day but the abdominal pain is there and she complains about it at least 3 times per day.  My dog is being treated for tapeworms could she has this worm in her body.  Please help I need advice.
title: 7 year old with abdominal pain and other symptoms
